snippet: The convention building has been a major site of avian fatalities, but a half-billion-dollar project has made it friendlier to wildlife.
abstract: Extensive $500 million renovation to Manhattan's Jacob K Javits Convention Center has made it both safer for and more hospitable to birds; alterations to center's glass surface keeps birds from crashing into sides while green roof provides habitat.
lead_paragraph: The convention building has been a major site of avian fatalities, but a half-billion-dollar project has made it friendlier to wildlife.

headline.main: Renovation at Javits Center Alleviates Hazard for Manhattan’s Birds
headline.print_headline: Alleviating a Hazard for Manhattan’s Birds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Javits, Jacob K, Convention Center (Manhattan, NY)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)
